text:
I've got some multithreaded code that continuously allocates and frees large matrices. The tasks never terminate, they just write their outputs to a channel that is consumed.
It appears that garbage collection never runs, and the process keeps on allocating until it gets OOM killed. If I stick a GC.gc() in the main loop, memory usage stays bounded.
I'm going to try and produce an MWE, but it might be a bit tricky.
Nonetheless, has anyone seen behaviour like this? It is driving me a bit nuts.
